description:
1. No groups.
2. Changing an address in Gnome Contacts (somebody moved) caused its position in my Google contacts to change (instead of first name first it became listed by last name first and it wasn't where it should have been in my Google contacts list.) Easy to fix but WHY???

It's a bit absurd that pressing 'n' in the program, regardless of having the search function selected, will open the new contact page. That means forget searching for any contacts with 'n' in the name. It became immediately unusable for me.
This has saved all my Contacts

GNOME Contacts, along with GNOME Calendar and To Do, will not work without GNOME Evolution as they all rely on Evolution's Exchange add-on, defeating their purpose.

I'd like to be able to just have Contacts etc. without having to install Evolution - Calendar etc. should all be able to get the Exchange add-on for its self.
summary: Doesn't support Outlook without 'GNOME Evolution' installed

description: First, setup page doesnt work. Uninstalled.
Unfortunately this doesn't sync with my online contacts
summary: Great for a Local Address book

description: I like the GUI and interface but, the icon isn't showing up.

Started it up and didn't even get past the setup. It asks you to select an account for your contacts, gives a blank list and doesn't have any way at all to add your online account. Needs somebody to do some serious work on it.
Nothing seems to be showing up and I am stuck on the Setup screen
Really minimalistic approach. But works without troubles with Google/GMail account, and that's pretty useful if needed.
it didn't even show my online account list even though I have already configured goolge and outlook.
The app will unexpectedly close for no dicernable reason.
stuck on start page. nothing works
A lot of nothing. Could not get past the start page.
summary: couldn't get past the start page

description: This virsion is not working
Can't synch my google contacts. No matter what my Being does, and check for possible online remedies, "gnome-contacts" simpy doesn't work at all.
fat lot of good this is, its useless, it doesn't work
Can not export contact, so useless
Is it possible to have an offline address book? because it doesn t give me the possibility to reate one

Another hopeless application from an amateur code writer. 

Clearly, this application is not expected to be the "Primary" database. There is absolutely no facility for exporting and backing up the data. How ridiculous! There is no way I'm going to enter perhaps 500 + data entries only to be unable to retrieve them from a Back-Up. 

The absence of Back-Up facilities should have been made completely clear in the initial descriptive text so I wouldn't have wasted my time with this rubbish, trying to find the actual database file so that I could create a copy on my Back-Up drive. No luck, though. It probably uses an internet based file somewhere! (which I will never use!)
 
This is yet another example why Linux will never gain traction over Windows and Mac. A substantial number of applications do not work 'straight out of the box' and the authors believe we all enjoy wasting our time attempting to get their broken, disjointed code to do something useful!

Thank goodness these code writers don't design and build cars! Our roads would be clogged with broken down cars!

Rant over. Thanks for reading this far.
boyna aplicasion
No se ha configurado una libreta de direcciones primaria?
две учетки гугл, не видит не одну
summary: две учетки гугл, не видит не одну
